text: Hey no worries! I'm sure you're bus, i don't seem to get notifications on Slack.

Anyway ye. The main idea is to do a good destruction sim with particles, debris and pyro however I'd also like the building to be procedural. We did a procedural building project at school, it's in another one of my reels.

attachments.title: ReelMay2019
attachments.text: All projects done in Houdini and Nuke. This is a mix of my favourite projects up to now. I have learnt a huge amount during my short time learning 3d and Houdini in particular. I can't wait to see what I can learn and produce in the future!
attachments.video_html: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/334192133?autoplay=1&app_id=122963" width="400" height="225" frameborder="0" allow="autoplay; fullscreen" allowfullscreen title="ReelMay2019"></iframe>

text: :point_up: It's the penultimate one on this reel. What do u think?

That would work well I think! The procedural building looks good. If you're able to adapt that setup, so that the building is built to be destructible, with windows and bricks and metal blocks all being set up with the relative attributes and settings, that would be a good project.

The breakdown for that shot would definitely highlight the features and best parts of the etup
